magpie.data.utilities.normalizers

Class RegularSolutionNormalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.data.utilities.normalizers.BaseDatasetNormalizer
      • magpie.data.utilities.normalizers.RegularSolutionNormalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Commandable, Options, Printable

    public class RegularSolutionNormalizer
extends BaseDatasetNormalizer
    Normalize data using regular solution model. Goal is to transform class variable based on stoichiometry of material by fitting a regular solution model to the class variable given associated composition.

    Let y be the variable to be normalized, x be the composition of the material where x[Z] is the fraction of element with atomic number Z, and y' be the normalized class variable.

    y = y' * sum[ x[i] * x[j] ] for j>i ]

    This model is designed to normalize class values where the class must be equal to zero for unary compositions, and increases in magnitude when the amount of mixing is large (e.g., formation energy).

    Note: You should filter out unary compositions before using this filter. This normalization procedure would lead to division by zero for unary compounds. For numerical stability, we multiple them by -1 during the normalization procedure, but we recommend you filter out unary entries before running this normalizer.

    Usage: *No Options*

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • computeMixingTerm

        public static double computeMixingTerm(CompositionEntry entry)
        Compute the mixing term for a solution model. This is defined as

        sum[ x[i] * x[j] ] for i where x[Z] is the fraction of element Z.

        Note: If number of elements is 1, returns -1.

        Parameters:
        entry - Entry for which to compute mixing term
        Returns:
        Value of mixing term
